page.title: 16Attitudes to rural living
page.content: Attitudes to living in a rural village vary with different age groups,and with work role of the residents.The elderly who are long standing rural dwellers love the village and wouldn't like to be anywhere else and generally take a great interest in community activities,i.e church.Quite a lot of those who commute to work in nearby towns look upon the village as a haven to return to after the rigours of work ,relaxing in the evening caring for their gardens.Generally they have less time to devote to the village.The young people's attitudes are that there is nothing to do in a village,so their parents spend time transporting them to activities outside the area.
